info.title: Blueprint Manifest API
info.description: Service to create and install Blueprint Manifest files

tags.name: Import
tags.description: Install or update a Blueprint Manifest

get.description: Get the current status of a blueprint (export or import)

post.description:
Creates a new Export Job with a list of available resources to export from the passed root resource.

Multiple root resources can be added by calling this multiple times with the same jobId

isExportingMultipleResources.description: Temporary flag to indicate if multiple resources are being exported

pipelineId.description: Pipeline ID selected when doing the sandbox sync

manifestId.description: ID of the installed manifest to load the resource addresses from

post.description: Triggers exporting a manifest file using selected resoruce ids for a job created with `createExportJob`

selectedResourceIds.description: An array of resource IDs to export

isExportingMultipleResources.description: Temporary flag to indicate if multiple resources are being exported

post.description: Create pre-signed S3 URL to upload a manifest file.

201.description: Pre-signed URL for POST / PUT upload

post.description:
Creates a new import job from an uploaded manifest file and returns the plan.

Creates an updated plan for an installed manifest when `manifest_id` is passed

allOf.description: s3ref of manifest file uploaded via `uploadManifest`

resourcesToIgnore.description: List of resources to ignore changes for

resourceReplacements.description: List of resource replacements to apply during import

resourcesToIgnore.description: List of resources to ignore changes for

resourceReplacements.description: List of resource replacements to apply during import

resourcesToIgnore.description: List of resources to ignore changes for

resourceReplacements.description: List of resource replacements to apply during import

get.description: List Blueprint Manifests installed to the organization

200.description: Installed Blueprint Manifests in the organization
Installed Blueprint Manifest in the Organization

delete.description:
Remove installed manifest from the org

Note that this does not delete the installed resources of the Manifest!

post.description: Pre-install a Blueprint based on a blueprint file

blueprint_file.description: URL to the blueprint zip file

post.description: Kick off a new blueprint installation job. Returns 202 Accepted with Location header pointing to the job resource

source_blueprint_file.description: URL to the blueprint zip file

post.description: Kick off a new blueprint export job. Returns 202 Accepted with Location header pointing to the job resource.
Add a resource to a Blueprint

schema.description: Whether to add this resource dependencies to the blueprint automatically

post.description: Sync dependencies of all root resources in a Blueprint
Bulk Add resources in a Blueprint

schema.description: Whether to add this resource dependencies to the blueprint automatically

put.description: Bulk update resources in a Blueprint

delete.description: Bulk delete resources in a Blueprint

put.description: Update a resource in a Blueprint

delete.description: Delete a resource from a Blueprint

get.description: Poll current state of a job.

post.description: Continue an installation job if it is waiting for user action.
Cancel a blueprint job if it is still running.

preinstall.description: Markdown content shown before starting to install the blueprint
preinstall.example: This is the content of the preinstall.md file which contains the blueprint description.

postinstall.description: Markdown content to be displayed when showing the plan to install blueprint
postinstall.example: This is the content of the postinstall.md file

is_verified.description: Whether the blueprint is verified by epilot

source_blueprint_id.description: ID of the blueprint that brought this blueprint to the destination org (deployed or installed)

is_root.description: When a resource is marked as root, we'll be able to keep track of it's dependencies

is_ready.description: when editing a blueprint, this indicates if the resource is ready to be exported and when installing a blueprint, this indicates if the resource is ready to be used

is_hidden.description: When a resource is marked as hidden, it's used to hide it from the UI

parent_resource_ids.description: Used to automatically remove resources with hard dependencies and to block deletion of resources with hard dependencies

impact_on_install_reason.description: Fields causing the updates / internal updates on a resource install

resources_to_ignore.description: List of resource addresses to ignore changes for. When a resource is marked as create, it will be ignored and not created.

ManifestID.description: ID of an imported / installed manifest

JobID.description: ID of an import or export job (state machine)

previous_jobs_ids.description: List of job IDs that were used to install the manifest

previous_jobs.description: List of jobs that were used to install the manifest

changes_reason.description: Fields causing the updates / internal updates on a resource install

source_id.description: Original ID of the exported resource

changes_reason.description: Fields causing the updates / internal updates on a resource install

manifest_file_path.description: The S3 key of the manifest file

plan_file_content.description: An URL to download the plan file

resources_to_export.description: An array of tree-like JSON objects or a singular tree-like JSON object representing the resources to import

large_resources_to_export_url.description: An URL to download the resources to export when the resources are too large to be included in the response

resources_to_import.description: An array of tree-like JSON objects or a singular tree-like JSON object representing the resources to import

large_resources_to_import_url.description: An URL to download the resources to import when the resources are too large to be included in the response

is_verified.description: Whether the manifest comes from a trusted source and is signed by epilot

source_blueprint_slug.description: URL slug of a blueprint from the epilot marketplace

source_blueprint_file.description: A URL to download the source blueprint file used to import the blueprint

install_status_description.example: This blueprint installation resulted in a partial deployment; some resources were created successfully, but  failed to complete the full resource setup.

is_verified.description: Whether the manifest comes from a trusted source and is signed by epilot

selected_resources_url.description: All the resources that were selected to be exported, used to pre-select the resources when updating a sandbox manifest

ready_imported_resources_url.description: All the resources that were marked as ready by the user

source_organization_id.description: ID of the organization that deployed the manifest

source_manifest_id.description: ID of the manifest that was deployed

last_triggered_at.description: When the deployment was last triggered

deployed_from.description: Information about the manifest that was deployed from, used to update existing deployments instead of always creating new ones

destination_organization_id.description: ID of the organization that the manifest was deployed to

destination_manifest_id.description: ID of the manifest that was deployed to

last_triggered_at.description: When the deployment was last triggered

deployed_to.description: Information about the manifest that was deployed to, used to update existing deployments instead of always creating new ones

created_at.description: When the manifest was first installed (applied)

updated_at.description: When the manifest was last updated (applied)

imported_resources.description: An array of tree-like JSON objects or a singular tree-like JSON object representing the resources to import

large_imported_resources_url.description: An URL to download the imported resources when the resources are too large to be included in the response

markdown.description: Markdown content part of a manifest file

manifest.description: Markdown content shown before installing the manifest
manifest.example: This is the content of the manifest.md file which contains the manifest descripton.

preinstall.description: Markdown content to be displayed when showing the plan to install blueprint
preinstall.example: This is the content of the preinstall.md file

postinstall.description: Markdown content to be displayed when showing the plan to install blueprint
postinstall.example: This is the content of the postinstall.md file

PreInstallRequirements.description: List of feature settings that must be enabled before installing the blueprint

name.description: a human readable name of the caller (e.g. user name, token name or email address)

user_id.description: epilot user id, when called by a user

token_id.description: token id, when called by API token

pipeline_id.description: Pipeline ID selected when doing the sandbox sync

originalAddress.description: Original resource ID to be replaced

replacementId.description: ID of the resource that will replace the original

replacementName.description: Name of the resource that will replace the original

ready_resources.description: Array of ids of resources selected to be ready by the user

destination_organization_id.description: ID of the organization that the manifest was deployed to

destination_manifest_id.description: ID of the manifest that was deployed to

JobID.name: job_id
JobID.description: ID of an import or export job

EpilotAuth.description: Authorization header with epilot OAuth2 bearer token
